text: Ira William McCollum Jr. (born July 12, 1944) is an American lawyer and Republican Party politician. He was a member of the United States House of Representatives from 1981 to 2001. McCollum was the Vice Chairman of the House Republican Conference. He voted to impeach President Bill Clinton and had a leading role in Clinton's trial in the Senate. McCollum was the Republican nominee for the United States Senate in 2000, however he lost to Democratic nominee Bill Nelson. McCollum ran for the Republican nomination for the U.S. Senate again in 2004 but lost to Mel Mart√≠nez. In 2006 he was elected Florida Attorney General and in 2010 he unsuccessfully ran for the Republican nomination for Governor of Florida, losing to businessman Rick Scott. ==References== ==Other websites== * Bill McCollum, official profile , Office of the Attorney General of Florida * Bill McCollum, official campaign site * * Campaign contributions at OpenSecrets.org (2004 Senate race) * Category:1944 births Category:Living people Category:United States representatives from Florida Category:Florida attorneys general Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians Category:American lobbyists
title: Bill McCollum
